entry.title: Most Power Is Restored in Kyiv as Russian Strikes Hit Southern Ukraine
entry.content: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky said that power to many homes had been restored but that the electricity network was still unstable.

entry.title: Vladimir Putin's Red Lines, War Aims Shift in Ukraine
entry.content: The Russian leader is seen as improvising after setbacks. ‘A degree of desperation,’ one academic says.

entry.title: Eurovision Voting Goes Global, Giving U.S. Fans a Say on European Musical Contest
entry.content: Americans will soon get a chance to vote in the Eurovision Song Contest, the musical competition that celebrates kitschy pop and helped launch the careers of ABBA and Celine Dion.
